intro: Kaempferia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered ginger, is a species of flowering plant in the Zingiberaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its elegant, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has strap-shaped, dark green leaves and produces rhizomes similar to those of other gingers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Kaempferia albiflora is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
